meanings.definition: The outer sole of a shoe or boot.
meanings.sent1: The outsoles of my sneakers are worn out from all the running.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the outsoles of your shoes for any signs of damage.
meanings.sent3: The outsoles of the boots decided to take a break and left the rest of the shoe behind.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the grip of the outsoles on the rocky terrain.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color of the outsoles made them stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: The bottom layer of a shoe that comes into contact with the ground.
meanings.sent1: Walking on rough surfaces can cause damage to the outsoles of your shoes.
meanings.sent2: The outsoles of his work boots provided excellent traction on the slippery floor.
meanings.sent3: The outsoles seemed to have a mind of their own as they guided her steps effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The outsoles acted as a shield, protecting his feet from the sharp rocks below.
meanings.sent5: The outsoles left imprints of adventure on the dusty trail.
